description: Redevelopment, behind retained boundary walls, to provide eight houses, six flats and two B1 units.
status: Called in by Secretary of State
decision: Called in by Secretary of State
site_name: Renbow House Demolished - Now Bouton Place
decision_conditions:
FORMAL DECISION:  Section 78 (Planning) Appeal

The Planning Inspectorate allow the appeal and grant planning permission for the erection of mews style development comprising eight mews houses, two 1-bed and one 2-bed flats, two 2-bed and one 3-bed duplex flats and 130 square metres of B1 accommodation at 1A Waterloo Terrace, Islington in accordance with the terms of the application number P001306 dated 20th June, 2000 and the plans submitted therewith, subject to the following conditions:

1.  The development hereby permitted shall be begun not later than the expiration of five years from the date of this decision.

2.  No alteration shall be made to existing walls positioned on the east, south and west boundaries of the site, as shown on Woods Warren Roof Survey Plan reference number 10193/1/A, in height or appearance without the prior and written permission of the Local Planning Authority.

3.  Details of a method statement demonstrating how the existing walls referred to in Condition 2 above are to be retained in an unaltered state shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before any building works commence.

4.  Details of all facing materials to include a sample panel of  brickwork showing facing brick, bond and joint shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any building works commence.

5.  Details, drawn to a scale of not less than 1:20 of elevations and sections through all external walls, including window and door openings and any other feature identified to the developer by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before building works commence.

6.  A landscaping scheme, to include all hard and soft landscape features and water features shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before any building works commence.   All landscaping shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved scheme and planning shall be completed during the first planting season after practical completion of the development.  Landscaping and tree planting shall be watered and maintained for two years after planting.  Trees or shrubs that die within five years of completion of the development shall be replaced with others of the same species or an alternative approved by the Local Planning Authority.

7.  Details, drawn to a scale of not less than 1:20 and showing the eaves and staircase enclosure at third floor level of that part of the development fronting Waterloo Terrace shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before building works commence.

8.  No extraction, ventilation unit, boiler flue or pipework additional to that shown on the drawings hereby approved shall be positioned on the north elevation, facing Waterloo Terrace, unless with the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

9.  No part of the building hereby permitted shall be first occupied before cycle parking accommodation shown on the approved plans has been provided and such facilities shall thereafter be retained exclusively for that purpose unless otherwise previously agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

10.  Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995, or any Order superseding or modifying that Order, no enlargement, improvement or other alteration, including any enlargement consisting of an addition to the roof of any dwelling house hereby approved, shall be undertaken without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.

11.  No more than one vehicle shall be parked at any time in the parking bay shown on the approved drawing and that bay shall be kept permanently available for use only by a person registered as being disabled.

12.  The roof of the west wing of the building hereby permitted, positioned adjacent to properties in Ba
